Julian Reschke wrote:
> John Panzer wrote:
> 
>>Both Content-Range and PATCH need to define infoset-level extensions.  
>>Content-Range might possibly be dropped silently by very broken 
>>intermediaries, but PATCH is known to be blocked by some proxies in 
>>certain configurations (e.g., Squid).  I don't see a clear winner.
> 
> 
> When a proxy blocks PATCH, it's either broken, or it's doing that on 
> purpose because it was told to.

Actually in the case of Squid, it's because the sysadmin never heard of 
PATCH and she's forced to enter the methods to allow explicitly: GET, 
PUT, DELETE, HEAD, POST.  (No wildcards.)  At least's my understanding.

It is amusing though that https tunnels or bypasses all of this security 
theater anyway.
